https://studio.code.org/s/csc-bookcovers.long_instructions: **This is an interactive digital book cover for _Wonder_ by R.J. Palacio!** - Press Run - Click on each of the main characters. - Then press the up arrow. - What do you notice? _Click Finish when you're ready to move on._

authored_hints.hint1: **Click on both** of the characters to see what they say!
authored_hints.hint2: Click the **up arrow** to see the book's summary.

behavior_descriptions.move a sprite, changing its direction ra: move a sprite, changing its direction randomly
behavior_descriptions.move a sprite to the right across the sc: move a sprite to the right across the screen
behavior_descriptions.rotate a sprite to its left: rotate a sprite to its left
behavior_descriptions.rotate a sprite to its right: rotate a sprite to its right

behavior_descriptions.move a sprite horizontally, reversing di: move a sprite horizontally, reversing direction if it touches the edges of the screen
behavior_descriptions.move a sprite upwards across the screen: move a sprite upwards across the screen
behavior_descriptions.randomly change the size of a sprite: randomly change the size of a sprite
behavior_descriptions.move a sprite to the left across the scr: move a sprite to the left across the screen
behavior_descriptions.move a sprite across the screen, reversi: move a sprite across the screen, reversing direction if it touches the edges
behavior_descriptions.move a sprite if the user is pressing th: move a sprite if the user is pressing the arrow keys
behavior_descriptions.randomly change the vertical position of: randomly change the vertical position of a sprite
behavior_descriptions.randomly set the rotation of a sprite: randomly set the rotation of a sprite
behavior_descriptions.Move a sprite to the left across the scr: Move a sprite to the left across the screen. When it goes off the left side of the screen, move it back to the right side of the screen.
behavior_descriptions.Move a sprite to the right across the sc: Move a sprite to the right across the screen. When it goes off the right side of the screen, move it back to the left side of the screen.
behavior_descriptions.Move a sprite up across the screen. When: Move a sprite up across the screen. When it goes off the top of the screen, move it back to the bottom of the screen.

https://studio.code.org/s/csc-bookcovers.short_instructions: Begin learning how to code an interactive book cover! Add the set heading block and the set subheading.
https://studio.code.org/s/csc-bookcovers.long_instructions: **Letâ€™s learn how to code an interactive book cover!** - First, drag the set heading block from the toolbox and connect it under when run. - Then add the set subheading. - You can change the title of your book in the heading and the author in the subheading. - Press Run

authored_hints.Hint1: The set heading block adds the title of the book to the cover. You can change the text if you want.
authored_hints.Hint2: The set subheading adds the author to the book cover! You can change the text here too.

https://studio.code.org/s/csc-bookcovers.short_instructions: Design your book cover with a set background block!
https://studio.code.org/s/csc-bookcovers.long_instructions: **Design your book cover with a background!** - Add a set background block to your code. - Choose a background that you like for this book cover. - Click Run

authored_hints.hint1: The set background block goes at the end of the program. After the other code under When run.
authored_hints.hint2:
Select a background from the dropdown menu

[blockly block][0]

https://studio.code.org/s/csc-bookcovers.short_instructions: Add the main character to the book cover with a make new sprite block. The say will make the sprite say something!
https://studio.code.org/s/csc-bookcovers.long_instructions: **Add a sprite to bring the main character of this book onto the cover!** - Connect a make new sprite block under the set background block. - Click the pin on the attached location block. - Then click where you want the sprite to go. - Press Run.

authored_hints.hint1: The location block is attached to the make new sprite block. To change a sprite's location, click the pin on the location block, then click where you want it to go. [][0]

https://studio.code.org/s/csc-bookcovers.short_instructions: Use the new set size block to change the size of Jordan.
https://studio.code.org/s/csc-bookcovers.long_instructions: **Let's learn to change the size of sprites!** - Use the new set size block to change the size of the main character. - Make sure to choose a size other than 100 - Click Run

authored_hints.hint1:
Make sure the costume on the `set size` block matches on costume on the `make new sprite` block.
<xml>
<block type="gamelab_makeNewSpriteAnon">
                    <field name="ANIMATION_NAME">"green_sweater_hand_in_pocket"</field>
                    <value name="LOCATION">
                      <block type="gamelab_location_picker" can_disconnect_from_parent="false">
                        <field name="LOCATION">{"x":91,"y":269}</field>
                      </block>
                    </value>

                        <next>
                          <block type="gamelab_setProp">
                            <field name="PROPERTY">"scale"</field>
                            <value name="SPRITE">
                              <block type="gamelab_allSpritesWithAnimation">
                                <field name="ANIMATION">"green_sweater_hand_in_pocket"</field>
                              </block>
                            </value>
                            <value name="VAL">
                              <block type="math_number">
                                <field name="NUM">250</field>
                              </block>
                            </value>
                          </block>
                        </next>
                      </block>
                    </next>
                  </block>
                </next>
              </block>
            </next>
          </block>
        </next>
      </block>
    </next>

  </block>
</xml>>

https://studio.code.org/s/csc-bookcovers.short_instructions: Add a second character to the book cover! Set the new sprite's size and location too.
https://studio.code.org/s/csc-bookcovers.long_instructions: **Add a second character to the book cover!** - Connect another make new sprite block to the end of your code. - Click the pin on the location block to move the character. - Add a set size block to change its size to something other than 100. - Press Run to see your changes!

authored_hints.Hint1: Both of your new blocks should be set to the same costume.

https://studio.code.org/s/csc-bookcovers.short_instructions: Add a when clicked event and then connect a say block to make the new character say something when you click on it!
https://studio.code.org/s/csc-bookcovers.long_instructions: **The main character will introduce themself when you click on them!** - Add a when clicked event anywhere in your workspace. - Add a say block to that event. - You can change the text if you would like. - Click Run then **click on the sprite** to test your code.

authored_hints.hint2: Remember, when clicked blocks can go anywhere in the workspace. They do not connect to the When run program.
authored_hints.hint1:
Connect a `say` block under a `when clicked` event block:

[blockly block][0]

https://studio.code.org/s/csc-bookcovers.short_instructions: Add a when clicked event and then connect a say block to make the new character say something when you click on it!
https://studio.code.org/s/csc-bookcovers.long_instructions: **Add another event to make the second character speak too!** - Add a when clicked event with the second character's costume. - Add a say block to that event. - You can change the text to change what Charlotte says. - Click Run then **click on both sprites** to test your code.

authored_hints.hint2: Remember, when clicked blocks can go anywhere in the workspace. They do not connect to the When run program.
authored_hints.hint1:
Connect a `say` block under a `when clicked` event block:

[blockly block][0]

https://studio.code.org/s/csc-bookcovers.short_instructions: Add a second when sprite clicked event and a print block to include the summary on this book cover
https://studio.code.org/s/csc-bookcovers.long_instructions: **Now, let's use a different event to add the summary of the book!** - Add a when up arrow pressed event to your workspace. - Connect a print block under that event. - Click Run then **press the up arrow** to test your code. _Hint: You can change the text in the print block._

authored_hints.hint1: Make sure to connect at least one `print` block under `when run`.

dsls.description: Choose from the activities below to add to your book cover! You can pick multiple options and do more than one!

csc_bookcover_foreground_2023.bubble_choice_description: Add a foreground effect to your book cover
csc_bookcover_foreground_2023.long_instructions: **Add Foreground Effects** - Add a do effect block to your code - Choose an effect that matches your book cover - Run your code and watch the effect! **When you're finished:** You can return to the previous choice levels and choose another extension to add to your book cover!

authored_hints.hint1:
Make sure to add a `do effect` block to your code.

<xml>
<block type="storylab_setForegroundEffect2">
  <field name="EFFECT">"bubbles"</field>
</block>
</xml>

csc_bookcover_behavior_2023.bubble_choice_description: Add a behavior to your sprites to have them change on the screen
csc_bookcover_behavior_2023.long_instructions: **Make your sprites change with behaviors!** - Add a sprite begins block to the when peach sprite is clicked event. - Choose one of the behaviors to have your sprite begin changing. - Click Run . - Try different behaviors until you find one that suits your book cover! **When you're finished:** You can return to the previous choice levels and choose another extension to add to your book cover!

authored_hints.hint1:
Make sure to add a `sprite begins` block and a `behavior` block to your code.

<xml>
<block type="gamelab_addBehaviorSimple">
  <value name="SPRITE">
    <block type="gamelab_allSpritesWithAnimation">
      <field name="ANIMATION">"face_peach_1"</field>
    </block>
  </value>
  <value name="BEHAVIOR">
    <block type="gamelab_behavior_get">
      <mutation></mutation>
      <field name="VAR" id="growing">growing</field>
    </block>
  </value>
</block>
</xml>

csc_bookcover_burst_2023.bubble_choice_description: Add burst effects to create new experiences on your book cover
csc_bookcover_burst_2023.long_instructions: **Add Burst Effects** to create an exciting event for your book cover - Add a create burst effect block to to the when peach sprite is clicked event. - Choose an effect from the dropdown and choose a sprite. - Enter the number of sprites you'd like to appear in your affect. - Run your code to see the effect! **When you're finished:** You can return to the previous choice levels and choose another extension to add to your book cover!

authored_hints.hint1:
Make sure to add a `create burst effect` block to your code.

<xml>
<block type="gamelab_makeBurst">
  <field name="EFFECT">"burst"</field>
  <field name="ANIMATION_NAME">"book"</field>
  <value name="NUM">
    <block type="math_number">
      <field name="NUM">3</field>
    </block>
  </value>
</block>
</xml>

dsls.markdown:
##Plan Your Digital Book Cover

It's time to make your plan!

>You should include: > - The title of the book > - The author > - Two of the main characters and one sentence to describe themselves > - A one-two sentence summary of the book **Here is a plan template you can copy to use yourself:** Book Cover Planning Guide.

https://studio.code.org/s/csc-bookcovers.short_instructions: To get started, add the set heading block and the set subheading.
https://studio.code.org/s/csc-bookcovers.long_instructions: **Get started with adding the title and author onto your book cover!** - First, drag the set heading block from the toolbox and connect it under when run. - Then add the set subheading. - **Type** the title of your book in the heading and the author in the subheading. - Press Run.

authored_hints.Hint1: The set heading block adds the title of the book to the cover.
authored_hints.Hint2: The set subheading adds the author to the book cover! Be sure to change the text.

https://studio.code.org/s/csc-bookcovers.short_instructions: Start with adding a background to your project.
https://studio.code.org/s/csc-bookcovers.long_instructions: **Add a background** - Add a set background block under set heading. - Choose a background that matches the setting. - Click Run to go to the next step.

https://studio.code.org/s/csc-bookcovers.short_instructions: Add a when clicked event and then connect a say block to make the main character say something when you click on it!
https://studio.code.org/s/csc-bookcovers.long_instructions: **What should the main character say when it is clicked?** - Add a when clicked event anywhere in your workspace. - Add a say block to that event. - Make sure the costumes are set the same on both blocks. - Type in what the character will say. - Click Run then **click on the sprite** to test your code.

authored_hints.hint2: Remember, when clicked blocks can go anywhere in the workspace. They do not connect to the When run program.
authored_hints.hint1:
Connect a `say` block under a `when clicked` event block:

[blockly block][0]

https://studio.code.org/s/csc-bookcovers.short_instructions: Add a second when sprite clicked event and a print block to include the summary on this book cover
https://studio.code.org/s/csc-bookcovers.long_instructions: **Code the second character to say something when it is clicked!** - Add a when sprite clicked event to your workspace. - Be sure to set the costume to the second character. - Connect a say block under the new event. - Add text to introduce the second character. - Click Run then **click both of the sprites** to test your code.

authored_hints.hint1:
Don't forget that events can go anywhere in the workspace. 

You should have a `when sprite clicked` event for each of your characters.

https://studio.code.org/s/csc-bookcovers.short_instructions: Add a second when sprite clicked event and a print block to include the summary on this book cover
https://studio.code.org/s/csc-bookcovers.long_instructions: **Now, let's use a different event to add the summary of the book!** - Add a when up arrow pressed event to your workspace. - Connect a print block under that event. - Click Run then **press the up arrow** to test your code. _Hint: You can change the text in the print block._

authored_hints.hint1: Make sure to connect at least one `print` block under `when run`.

https://studio.code.org/s/csc-bookcovers.short_instructions: Add the finishing touches to your final project!
https://studio.code.org/s/csc-bookcovers.long_instructions:
**Finishing Touches** 

-   Look at the checklist on the back of your plan, did you add everything you need?

-   Do you have at least two characters?

-   Does the book's summary print when you press the up arrow?

-   Does your code work as expected?

### Great job coding a digital book cover!

dsls.markdown:
##Share Your Book Cover
**Now that you have coded your book cover, it's time to share it out!** As you view your classmates' projects consider the following questions: >1. What sprites and dialogue did you see in your classmates' book covers? >2. What happens when you click on the characters? >2. How were their choices similar to yours? How were they different? >3. Would you want to read the book based on its cover?
